intro: Narcissus herminicus, commonly known as the Spanish daffodil, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, particularly found in regions such as Spain and Portugal. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Narcissus herminicus is known for its hardiness and ability to naturalize over time, creating dense clusters of blooms in spring.
